headline: Mom's Apple Fritters
description: Easy apple fritters made with fresh apples in a simple batter are fried until golden brown and crisp and tossed in cinnamon sugar for a fall treat.

video.description: See how to make warm, crisp apple fritters from scratch.
video.name: Mom's Apple Fritters

name: Mom's Apple Fritters
recipeIngredient: 3 cups apples - peeled, cored and chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a deep fryer or electric skillet to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Stir together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. Pour in milk, eggs, and oil; stir until well blended.
Mix in apples until evenly distributed.
Working in small batches to prevent overcrowding, drop spoonfuls of batter into the deep fryer and fry in hot oil until golden all over, about 5 minutes.
Use a slotted spoon to transfer fritters to a paper towel-lined plate.
Toss warm fritters with cinnamon sugar in a bowl until well coated.

review.reviewBody: I didn’t think they had much flavor . They puffed up a lot and were dark on outside and doughy inside.

Did not like this. I made as recipe called for. Dead apple fritters. No flavor. How do i remove this recipe. I would not make again. If i did i sure would add cinnamon, vanilla, baking powder, more sugar.
This is exactly the same as my grandma's recipe that we made as kids. Yum! We would sprinkle them with cinnamon sugar or powdered sugar or dip them in syrup.

This is a great and simple recipe!! My 5th time making it. I made a few adjustments by adding 1/4c of sugar, 4c of apples, 1tsp of vanilla, a bit more milk, and reducing the amt. of baking powder. I also added 2 tbs. of melted butter instead of oil. Next time I'll try adding a bit of almond extract.

I added a couple of splashes of milk in order to fully incorporate the dry ingredients. I also added a half teaspoon each of nutmeg, and cinnamon to the dry ingredients. I'm super pleased with this recipe. The fritters were light and creamy. Definitely adding this to my recipes.

you will not find taste like this at your local store! these apple fritters are soft moist and fluffy, full of flavor, free of preservatives and must be eaten within a couple of days, best if consumed immediately after being prepared!
I added 1/2 T sugar, plus cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and cloves; good that way and no glaze or cinnamon sugar was needed.
Almost exactly the same as my mom's recipe! She always served with sausage patties, and we ate them with syrup. My daughters always loved them for supper whenever their dad had to go out of town!
I disliked how crunchy the apples still were.

Great recipe, added 1 tsp cinnamon and 1 tsp apple pie spice to the dough, cut the apples into tiny pieces. Glazes with 1 cup icing sugar, 1 tsp cinnamon. Delicious, everyone from the grandkids to the adults LOVED them, this is a keeper recipe.

I hate to review recipes when I didn’t make them exactly as published, but so many people made the same substitutions, and it was great. Apple sauce instead of oil in the batter. I didn’t have 3 cups of apples, so used the two I had. Added vanilla and cinnamon and more sugar to the batter. I think they would be bland otherwise. I grated the apple and I think chunks would be better as I really couldn’t tell these were apple fritters.
These were pretty boring. The dough was incredibly bland. We were disappointed.

Great recipe! I read the suggestions and doubled the recipe but kept the chipped up apples at 3 cups. I used a spoon to drop the dough into the hot oil and that worked perfectly. I kept the oil at 350 degrees and they each took around 6 minutes to fry. The dble recipe made almost 50 of them for a 2 bite-size. My husband turned a few into mini funnel cakes with ice cream, whipped cream and strawberries and they held beautifully.

I just made these this morning just giving it a try and I'm glad I did. I won't have to go to the donut shop now! I made only half recipe which made about 8. I followed the recipe I did add tsp of cinnamon bc I looooove cinnamon with apples and a splash of vanilla. I used my cookie scoop for dropping in oil and they puff pretty big. no complaints here 5 star
Made this recipe as is...yum!
Simple and loving it!
Perfect as written and SO fast and easy!
I didn't like taste because really wasn't none. And texture was great.
Changes...2 cups flour, 1/3 cup OJ, 3 tablespoons sugar, also, cook apples in 1 tablespoon of butter, cook until tender, add 1 tablespoon of sugar, add to batter. Taste great!
Pretty good! I made a double batch and they disappeared fast!
I. Added cinnamon to the dough
A great , easy to follow recipe that is a big hit with my crew! Thanks so much for sharing this recipe!

Thanks for the wonderful recipe. When we make it again we will increase the sugar and decrease the milk a bit so the batter is firmer. Overall it's a great place to start and was easy enough to make with the kids, though I did handle the frying myself.
I loved it. Only changes I plan next time is to let the cook another 1-2 minutes and sit to allow the oil to drain on paper towels a little longer. Loved it, thanks for sharing...
Simply delicious

Made per recipe, but I quartered, cored, and cooked 8 small apples in 2cps water, 1 cup sugar, 1cup brown sugar, 2 tbsp cinnamon, 1 tsp allspice, 1 tbsp low salt seasoning salt. I'm in the new Orleans area and Tony's low salt is the best. I chopped up ha the apples for the fritters. I chopped the rest of the apple and added them back to the syrup made when I cooked them. I used this as a glaze. Bon apitit
they are good, but I would add more flour to thicken up. and a bit more sugar.
Easy peasy and really tasty. Then as something new I threw in diced banana really yummy!!!

This was a nice simple apple fritter recipe. We made it just as posted here. They were delicious. Although a little bland for my liking in the center. I think I may try some other suggestions on here or at the very least coat the apples in Cinnemon sugar before adding them to the batter. But it was a nice treat as it is here too! Thank you for sharing!
I did as others suggested and doubled the batter while keeping the apples the same. They turned out delicious. Everyone in the family loved them. Served them with honey butter. Very easy to make!

This was such a simple recipe! I had self-rising flour, so I used it in place of the regular flour and didn’t add any baking powder. I did make the apples into tiny chunks, about the size of a pinky nail, and they turned out great!
Tried apple fritters for the first time, they turned out above all expectations!
Pretty much like my grañnies recipe, my grandson loves these.

Ridiculously easy and incredibly delicious! Thank you so much for sharing this recipe!
Gluten-free version was super easy! I used Cup4Cup and added about 1/4 cup more milk because the batter was VERY thick.
To Instant Pot users: use the sauté function to heat up the oil. Make sure it comes to full heat (display will show "Hot) before you put in your fritters. Use a medium cookie scoop for portioning.
pretty awesome apple fritters

I made these this morning! The batter was very heavy and because it was heavy after 5 minutes in the frying oil pan the insides were still not cooked, so leaving them in longer made them hard and dark. I had a thermometer in the oil at 190 and this is still how they turned out! Very disappointed followed the recipe to a tee!

I had extra apples and thought this might be the trick; it was. I used the main recipe but added BROWN SUGAR instead and grated the apples since I thought they would cook better. I kept the temp at 350 as well. Marvelous. And the left over batter can be stored in the fridge one day, the cooked product 2 days on the counter (reheat to 350 for 8 min) and can be frozen for 2 months. YUM
I made this recipe and it was a big hit. I got request for the office and for special school friends. Thank you for making me a supermom. ??
These are great, I made them exactly as the recipe said and they turned out great.
so good!!
We added a little extra cinnamon to batter. Turned out great loved them.
I made according to recipe and they turned out really good! I used Granny Smith apples, but would be willing to try different apples for a different taste. Also, I
Wonderful. Will definitely make again
This is sooo good. I cooked the apples a little bit and it turned out very well.

I just made these and they’re terrible.... the apples are too hard and the batter tastes bland and gross. I’m very disappointed. Other recipes tell you to cook your apples in cinnamon and sugar before incorporating with batters or doughs which I would imagine gives the fritter some flavor. I am so sad, so very very sad.

I made these little babies about a year ago and let me tell you something I doubled the recipe and made a load of them. By the next morning they were all gone. My family devoured them. I'd recommend this recipe to anyone who asked me.

Made few batches following the recipe. I tried substituting flour and other dry ingredients with Bisquick. What an improvement! Lighter and fluffier!
Also have tried various flavor enhancers and fruits. Pineapple and coconut extract, Peanut Butter Caramel powder with apple. Have enjoyed them all.

So very easy to make and yummy. I added 2 t of cinnamon in flour. Also, I put batter in to oil from bowl. It is a thick batter so it does not come out fast. Don't put batter in thick, thin it out it will cook quicker and not get really dark on outside. Highly recommend.
Super easy to make and everyone enjoyed it. My new to go dessert!
Good and quick. Halved the recipe for 4. Best when they are hot and ate right away.

Turned out great, and my kids love them. I doubled the recipe and it made a lot of fritters. The only change I made was adding a tsp of cinnamon and a tsp of vanilla to the batter. 

They're the perfect level of sweetness with the cinnamon sugar sprinkled on top
I had an abundance of apples to use before they went bad, tried this recipe and found it quite tasty. I really liked them after a few hours I made them.

I am crazy about this Recipe.
I just want to know how to make the fritters larger size, like they sell at the bakeries

Instructions were easy to follow and for a first time attempt they turned out really well. I would absolutely make these again. They were a quick and easy desert treat for our holiday meal but would be a great addition to any occasion!
I added vanilla to the mixture & used apple pie filling i had made but was extra.
I added vanilla and about 1/4 cp of sugar instead of a table spoon to the mix. These are amazing and my family loves them. Would recommend
Totally my new favorite autumn treat! I substituted wheat free, gluten free flour and used probably a cup more apples than called for. I always use extra fruit! They turned out just perfect!!
Very good. I made it using gluten free Pamela’s Baking Flour. It was very delicious.

I didn't make any changes and we really liked them, I think my dough was a little too thin, and I should have made the powdered sugar icing instead of just sprinkling powdered sugar on them, but there will be a next time to do all those things./u

no changes, I will make this again regularly!

I chose to make this with the pulp leftover after using my cider press, but I may try it again with apples out of season, fresh from the store!

They were light and tasty, quick, easy, and made the house smell fantastic!
No flavor, not good.
I warmed up the apples prior to putting them in the batter just to take some of the crunchiness out. Absolutely delicious! Everyone loved it!!!

LOVE LOVE LOVE these fritters!!!!
Big thank you to your mom & you for the recipe.
Made these several times already.
Hint- noticed the ones I make towards the end, the dough comes out fluffier. Tonight, I left the dough in a bowl for about 20 minutes covered with in Saran Wrap before frying the fritters. All of the fritters were definitely fluffier this way.

Made it for first time modifying spices as I didn’t have vanilla or cinnamon. I added cloves, nutmeg and ginger and rolled them out in brown sugar. They were much better than the ones from coffee shop.

I made these exactly the way the recipe said to. The fritters were light and fluffy but didn't have a lot of flavour. So the second time I made them I added an extra tablespoon of sugar and a tablespoon each of nutmeg and cinnamon. They were melt in your mouth delicious. They didn't even need to be rolled in cinnamon sugar. This is definitely a recipe I will be using again and again!!!
These are AMAZING just as is! They are my hubby's favorite and they didn't disappoint. Took a few over to the neighbor and he ate all of them without sharing any with his wife!
Love these. I add extra apple and they disappear in a flash.

I added 1/4C of my own Cinnamon Sugar mixture to the batter, on top of the 1Tbsp that was called for. Used Buttermilk because I was out of whole milk. Fried them for 2.5 minutes a side and they were awesome! Side Note: Use Saigon Cinnamon, rather than regular. It has a MUCH better flavor.

I've made these every fall, for the last several years. Can't believe I've never reviewed it! My family loves these! We have lots of apple trees and I gather some in a bowl, remove all the spots/bruises and chop them for these. I like to make them in the early fall, on a crisp day. The kids come home from school and smell these and gets everyone in the fall spirit!

I did not have any all purpose flour on hand. So I substituted and used self rising flour instead. added about 1 shake of baking powder, and, (wallah), perfect. I glazed a few, then cinnamon and sugar, with glaze drizzle for the rest. My son really likes them, and I had to eat two right away. A very fast and tasty treat. Used apple filling out of a can. perfect crowd pleaser.
Halved the apples....mmmmmmmmmm good!!!
I made this exactly as is and it was amazing!

I diced the apples & made them like I make my apple pie filling. Then I just dumped the entire bowl into the batter. They were so good! No sugar or oil in the batter. (the apple pie filling had enough sugar) I vanilla glazed. Don't cover right away they get soft.

Quick, easy and yummy! First time making fritters- followed the recipe and the only thing I changed was to drop the heat of oil a touch and decrease the cooking time. Had I not done that, they’d have been “crispy little fritters”- as in BURNT. Maybe it’s because I live at a higher altitude. Anyway, these are a delicious treat! Thanks for sharing!
Always good

Simple to make, Tasted great! 10/10 would make again

Changes:
(I was too lazy to cut off the skin and it worked fine)

I added some vanilla and cinnamon to the batter it self and these came out PERFECT!! not too sweet. my husband loves apple fritters now I don't have to spend money on the dry, sugar pumped, practically appleless ones at the store.
GOod but needed a little more sugar
I made it as is but I have another recipe that uses only one egg and the dough is a bit lighter. We found this a bit heavy.

Don’t change anything! It looks like the ratio of apples to batter is too even, but it is just right! Trust the recipe! Fry in spoon-size pieces for the best results. I chopped the apples to small pieces instead of chunks so they’d cook as fast as the batter. Great recipe...and really easy.

AWESOME RECIPE, FINALLY!!

I have tried several different apple fritter recipes and most of them were good, but the batter was wrong, or they cooked clumpy, these cook in fry in whatever size or shape you want them too, I always add a touch more sugar, and a lot more cinnamon, I also like making a light glaze by using a 1 1/2 cup of powdered sugar, a teaspoon of cinnamon and 1/3 cup of milk... try it, it's awesome!
This recipe had no flavor in the batter. I rechecked the recipe and I made it per directions.
It was great
Super simple, tasty & inexpensive to make plus a time saver!
Delicious! So easy, I had fresh frozen apples and decided to try them with this recipe, so good, yum
No changes! Great the way they are. To me if you're gonna change the recipe it's a different recipe.

Love these! Super quick and easy. I was looking for a substitute for doughnuts for my son who is allergic to eggs and milk. I replaced the milk with coconut milk and used an egg free egg replacer for the egg. I grated 1 apple into the batter to avoid chunks of apple for my son. Next time I will add a little cinnamon to the batter for increased flavor.

Fabulous! Better by far than any we’ve ever bought! And, as I have to be gluten-free, which means I can’t eat the bought ones any more, I’m delighted to have this recipe! I substituted King Arthur 1 to 1 gf flour, but there are plenty of others available. 

We tried adding a combination of cinnamon and clove into the icing for apple butter taste, or cardamom for a citrusy zing. More combinations in our future. 

Thank you!

Thank you for sharing the deliciousness! I wanted a quick dessert on a crisp fall day, the deep fryer was already out, and so everything just came together :-) I lowered the temp as per some reviews and they didn't take 5 minutes, maybe 4. I added extra cinnamon and nutmeg because we like it and used butter instead of oil (because BUTTER). I should have followed your directions and cut the apples roughly, I followed another review who found the pieces too big so I cut them small...but I missed the chunks of tart Granny Smith apple, and I've made a note of it for next time. I rarely deep fry anything, I drag that thing out of limbo maybe twice a year - but your Mom's apple fritters, along with MY Mom's corn fritters, will be on the semi-annual fry fest menu now ;-) Cheers!

These were amazing. The only changes I made were using 1/3 cup milk and 1/3 apple cider instead of 2/3 cup milk, and added 1 Tbsp of cinnamon to the batter. We did half with the cinnamon sugar mix and then half with the apple cider glaze from the Apple Cider Glazed Doughnuts recipe. The fritters with the glaze were by far the favorite. I used a small scoop for most and then tried just dropping some in the oil to make bigger fritters. The bigger ones were more crisp on the outside and tender on the inside. We will definitely be trying this one again.

This recipe is good in that it is simple and uses a lot of apple in the batter. But the taste left something to be desired. Perhaps more salt? More cinnamon? I used honey crisp apple. At 375 degrees oil, the outside of fritter turned brown quickly, but the inside was still gooey. They are tasty in cinnamon sugar, but not a hit out of the park. I need to compare to other fritter recipes.
This recipe turned out great. Everybody loved it! Plus it gave me an excuse to use the fry daddy ????????. ????????????
LOVE LOVE LOVE I only had half&half cream, so I used that instead of milk - and I only used 1 teaspoon of baking powder ..... quite good! Thank you!
It was good, but "something" was missing. I can't quite put my finger on it. Made it just as written. Glazed with a powdered sugar/cinnamon glaze.

This recipe is absolute perfection! My husband loves when I make these. Apple season just got even more popular in my house. I didn’t change a thing for this recipe. This is a southern staple that will never leave our house recipe book!
Just like the Apple Harvest!! Yaay!! ^_^

I didn't want to spoil my original review with comments, so here are some now. I made one change. I cooked the apple bits. I put a tablespoon of butter in a fry pan, added the apple bits after the butter started turning brown, then sprinkled on a tablespoon of cinnamon. I cooked them until the majority were sort of translucent. 
I would use less milk next time. The mixture was too runny. Perhaps I will try 1/2 cup instead of 2/3.
easy and great taste
yum
